question: Some people believe that children should spend all of their free time with their families. Others believe that this is unnecessary or even negative. Discuss the possible arguments on both sides, and say which side you personally support.
text: It is believed by some people that children are ought to always stay with their families when they have free time. However, others argue that this habit has a detrimental effect. Although each argument has its own advantages, I believe that it is unnecessary for children to spend all their free time with their families and that they should be given freedom to have fun in safe environments with their peers.

On the one hand, when children spend time exclusively with their parents, be them guardians or foster parents, their bond grows stronger. Children would start viewing their parents as their role models, and thus, absorb conventions and codes of conduct that are essential for the child’s development from them. Hopefully, this would ensure that children do not engage in bullying, truancy, or delinquency when they grow up. Additionally, being present with their families the whole time can protect children from dangers, for example, abduction.

On the other hand, this habit can adversely affect the development of the child. If children socialized with their families only and were not permitted to see other children their age, this would result in them developing social anxiety and even being too dependent on their parents. Moreover, working parents are not always present in the house and, thus, cannot always take care of the child.

To conclude, spending an adequate amount of time with their families is essential for healthy bonding and the development of the child. However, they should not be restricted to being with their families only, and instead be allowed to socialize with other well brought-up peers and engage in healthy and entertaining activities supervised by their parents.
